content: The 19-count indictment charges Blagojevich and some of his closest aides and advisers with a wide-ranging "scheme to deprive the people of Illinois of honest government," The charges are part of what investigators have dubbed "Operation Board Games," an ongoing investigation into political corruption in the state. Among the specific claims in the 75-page indictment are that Blagojevich schemed with others in 2002, even before he took office, to use his position to make money, which they would split after he left office. Full article +http://www.cnn.com/2009/POLITICS/04/02/illinois.blagojevich/index.html PDF file of the indictment +http://i.cdn.turner.com/cnn/2009/images/04/02/blago.indictment.pdf Looks as if the government is looking to sieze assets of Blogo and associates, some of the charges are made under the RICO Act. I wonder if George will keep the bottom bunk when his celly moves into the "retired Governors clubhouse"?
